author: andyc
msg: Improved measurement of "tagginess". Previously, I wasn't
counting attribute values and processing instruction data
in the total character count. This is important because
despite whether people decide to use attributes or elements
to hold their data, it *is* data. My decision to include
PIs in the measurement is relatively arbitrary and can be
debated. However, PIs do hold data (which is meaningful
for the application) so I include them in the measurement

author: andyc
msg: Minor updates. I changed the code entered by lehors on 19 Jun.
Instead of overriding parse() to call reset(), the base parser
class has a protected reset method that *its* parse method
calls. So noone down the inheritence chain has to override
parse just to call reset. And since overriders of reset are
required to call super.reset(), I think this solution is

author: neilg
msg: fix for bug #2154.  Also cleaned up some code.
